codeSystems.name: Scpqual
codeSystems.title: pan-Canadian Provider Qualification Types
codeSystems.description: SCPQUAL is used to encode the degree or educational rank of a healthcare provider credential as defined by the various Royal Canadian Professional Medical Collages. It is also supports the encoding “Expertise type” in the pan-Canadian version 3 messages

codeSystems.name: AddressType
codeSystems.title: AddressType
codeSystems.description: The type of an address (physical / postal).

codeSystems.name: AddressUse
codeSystems.title: AddressUse
codeSystems.description: The use of an address.

codeSystems.name: AdministrativeGender
codeSystems.title: AdministrativeGender
codeSystems.description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

codeSystems.name: BundleType
codeSystems.title: BundleType
codeSystems.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle - how it is intended to be used.

codeSystems.name: CareTeamStatus
codeSystems.title: CareTeamStatus
codeSystems.description: Indicates the status of the care team.

codeSystems.name: ContactPointSystem
codeSystems.title: ContactPointSystem
codeSystems.description: Telecommunications form for contact point.

codeSystems.name: ContactPointUse
codeSystems.title: ContactPointUse
codeSystems.description: Use of contact point.

codeSystems.name: DaysOfWeek
codeSystems.title: DaysOfWeek
codeSystems.description: The days of the week.

codeSystems.name: HTTPVerb
codeSystems.title: HTTPVerb
codeSystems.description: HTTP verbs (in the HTTP command line). See [HTTP rfc](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) for details.

codeSystems.name: IdentifierUse
codeSystems.title: IdentifierUse
codeSystems.description: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

codeSystems.name: IssueSeverity
codeSystems.title: IssueSeverity
codeSystems.description: How the issue affects the success of the action.

codeSystems.name: IssueType
codeSystems.title: IssueType
codeSystems.description: A code that describes the type of issue.

codeSystems.name: LocationMode
codeSystems.title: LocationMode
codeSystems.description: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.

codeSystems.name: LocationStatus
codeSystems.title: LocationStatus
codeSystems.description: Indicates whether the location is still in use.

codeSystems.name: NameUse
codeSystems.title: NameUse
codeSystems.description: The use of a human name.

codeSystems.name: OrganizationAffiliationRole
codeSystems.title: Organization Affiliation Role
codeSystems.description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the role of one Organization in relation to another.

codeSystems.name: ResourceType
codeSystems.title: ResourceType
codeSystems.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

codeSystems.name: SearchEntryMode
codeSystems.title: SearchEntryMode
codeSystems.description: Why an entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.

codeSystems.name: LOINC
codeSystems.title: Logical Observation Identifiers, Names and Codes (LOINC)
codeSystems.description: LOINC provides a set of universal names and ID codes for identifying laboratory and clinical test results.1,2 LOINC facilitates the exchange and pooling of results, such as blood hemoglobin, serum potassium, or vital signs, for clinical care, outcomes management, and research. LOINC's universal identifiers (names and codes) can be used in the context of order and observation exchanges between information systems that use syntax standards such as HL73, CEN TC251, ISO TC215, ASTM4, and DICOM. Specifically, the identifier can be used as the coded value for an observation in any other standard that uses the observation/observation value paradigm, whether messages, documents, application programming interface (API), etc. For example, LOINC codes are used widely in the OBX segment Observation Identifier field (OBX-3) of an ORU HL7 (HL7 version 2.x or ASTM 1238-9410) message that may be sent between a Clinical Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) and Electronic Health Record Systems (EHR).5, 6 In this way, LOINC codes provide universal identifiers that allow the exchange of clinical data between heterogeneous computing environments.

codeSystems.name: SNOMED_CT
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT (all versions)
codeSystems.description: SNOMED CT is the most comprehensive and precise clinical health terminology product in the world, owned and distributed around the world by The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).

codeSystems.name: ContactEntityType
codeSystems.title: Contact entity type
codeSystems.description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the purpose for which you would contact a contact party.

codeSystems.name: LocationType
codeSystems.title: Location type
codeSystems.description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the physical form of the Location.This includes several 'non physical' codes which are still considered a location.

codeSystems.name: OperationOutcomeCodes
codeSystems.title: Operation Outcome Codes
codeSystems.description: Operation Outcome codes used by FHIR test servers (see Implementation file translations.xml)

codeSystems.name: Program
codeSystems.title: Program
codeSystems.description: This value set defines an example set of codes that could be can be used to classify groupings of service-types/specialties.

codeSystems.name: ServiceCategory
codeSystems.title: Service category
codeSystems.description: This value set defines an example set of codes that can be used to classify groupings of service-types/specialties.

codeSystems.name: ServiceProvisionConditions
codeSystems.title: ServiceProvisionConditions
codeSystems.description: The code(s) that detail the conditions under which the healthcare service is available/offered.

codeSystems.name: ReferralMethod
codeSystems.title: ReferralMethod
codeSystems.description: The methods of referral can be used when referring to a specific HealthCareService resource.

codeSystems.name: ServiceType
codeSystems.title: Service type
codeSystems.description: This value set defines an example set of codes of service-types.

codeSystems.name: BedStatus
codeSystems.title: bedStatus
codeSystems.description: Code system of concepts which specify the state of a bed in an inpatient setting, and is used to determine if a patient may be assigned to it or not.  Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging in the DLD and PV1 segments.

codeSystems.name: IdentifierType
codeSystems.title: identifierType
codeSystems.description: HL7-defined code system of concepts specifying type of identifier. Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging data types CX, PLN, PPN, XCN and XON.

codeSystems.name: Confidentiality
codeSystems.title: Confidentiality
codeSystems.description: A set of codes specifying the security classification of acts and roles in accordance with the definition for concept domain "Confidentiality".

codeSystems.name: RoleCode
codeSystems.title: RoleCode
codeSystems.description: A set of codes further specifying the kind of Role; specific classification codes for further qualifying RoleClass codes.

codeSystems.name: RoleStatus
codeSystems.title: RoleStatus
codeSystems.description: Codes representing the defined possible states of an Role, as defined by the Role class state machine.

codeSystems.name: Ietf3066
codeSystems.title: Tags for the Identification of Languages
codeSystems.description: Older value from OID registry.  Superceded; see recommendations in BCP-47.
